duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide support for health and welfare benefit programs within the organization.
Serve as the primary liaison between the workforce and Human Resources Department, offering customer support, education, and benefit plan administration.
Coordinate and implement wellness programming, including webinars, health literacy programs, employee challenges, and benefits fairs.
Design and build pivot tables, use slicers, and analyze data in MS Excel.
Lead benefit presentations at new hire orientation and engage in public speaking.
Run processes, analyze data, make deduction edits, and understand the impact on payroll using benefit administration software programs.
Proficiently use Infor or comparable HRIS system for benefit administration.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or equivalent required. BA degree preferred. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) or seeking CEBS certification is desirable.
